channel.title: Adding shops problems
channel.description: i tryed adding shops to my staff zone and im useing shopmaker v1.0 by jaywalker i followed ever thing it said and when i compile it says 100 errors

item.title: Adding shops problems
item.dc:creator: @_Urban !.::Urban.::!
item.description:
@_Urban wrote:

[quote=“Imnotokkk, post:6, topic:259514”]To start off you need an npc i think you get npc’s id’s best by going on moparscape client and search there.

When you finded your npc that you want to be the shop keeper

Add the npc to autospawn.cfg

It would be like this

spawn = 619    2843	3675	0	0	0	0	0	2	seller

First ### is NPC’s id, next ones is coords and you dont have to edit the last numbers.

And to get coords for the npc just go to spot you want the npc to be and type ::mypos (Should be in all sources)

Next you need to add items to the shop

So open shops.cfg

Heres an example:

shop = ##	Herb Shop				2	2	(itemid)      (amount)       (itemid)       (amount)       (ect)        (ect)

“Herb shop” is the name of the shop wich will see when you open the shop

And last part. Open client.java and search for

WanneShop = 30;

And if you dont find that, search for


case 155: //first Click npc

And scroll down for few secs until you see alot of wanneshops.

Then just add

else if (NPCID == ####) { // Id of Npc
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = ##; //Id of shop
}

So you put npc’s id to NPCID == ####) {
And Shops id to WanneShop = ##; (Put the same number what you putted in shops.cfg to this:

shop = -->##<-- Herb Shop 2 2 [/quote]

Okay, you basically took this tutorial off from Ragezone. I read this tutorial before, and it has EXACT same words.
Give the creator some credits dude, don’t take people’s tutorials. Use your own knowledge to help people.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding shops problems
item.dc:creator: @Imnotokkk Imnotokkk
item.description:
@Imnotokkk wrote:

To start off you need an npc i think you get npc’s id’s best by going on moparscape client and search there.

When you finded your npc that you want to be the shop keeper

Add the npc to autospawn.cfg

It would be like this

spawn = 619    2843	3675	0	0	0	0	0	2	seller

First ### is NPC’s id, next ones is coords and you dont have to edit the last numbers.

And to get coords for the npc just go to spot you want the npc to be and type ::mypos (Should be in all sources)

Next you need to add items to the shop

So open shops.cfg

Heres an example:

shop = ##	Herb Shop				2	2	(itemid)      (amount)       (itemid)       (amount)       (ect)        (ect)

“Herb shop” is the name of the shop wich will see when you open the shop

And last part. Open client.java and search for

WanneShop = 30;

And if you dont find that, search for


case 155: //first Click npc

And scroll down for few secs until you see alot of wanneshops.

Then just add

else if (NPCID == ####) { // Id of Npc
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = ##; //Id of shop
}

So you put npc’s id to NPCID == ####) {
And Shops id to WanneShop = ##; (Put the same number what you putted in shops.cfg to this:

shop = -->##<--	Herb Shop				2	2

Read full topic
